t: The Hope of the Faithful, and the Messiah’s Victory
Preserve*pn me, O God, for in You I put my trust.
O*iln my*i soul,*i you have said to the Lord,*s “You*ld are*i my Lord, My*ld goodness is nothing apart from You.”
As*ld for the saints who are*i on the earth, “They*ld are the excellent ones, in whom is all my delight.”
Their*ln sorrows shall be multiplied who hasten after*i another god;*i Their*ld drink offerings of blood I will not offer, Nor*ld take up their names on my lips.
O*ln Lord,*s You*i are*i the portion of my inheritance and my cup; You*ld maintain my lot.
The*ld lines have fallen to me in pleasant places;*i Yes,*ld I have a good inheritance.
I*ln will bless the Lord*s who has given me counsel; My*ld heart also instructs me in the night seasons.
I*ld have set the Lord*s always before me; Because*ld He*i is*i at my right hand I shall not be moved.
Therefore*ln my heart is glad, and my glory rejoices; My*ld flesh also will rest in hope.
For*ld You will not leave my soul in Sheol, Nor*ld will You allow Your Holy One to see corruption.
You*ld will show me the path of life; In*ld Your presence is*i fullness of joy; At*ld Your right hand are*i pleasures forevermore.
